body.name: Carhartt Men's Casual Nylon Webbing Belts, Available in Multiple Styles, Colors & Sizes
features: Carhartt Men's Nylon Webbing Ladder Lock Belt. Heavy-duty nylon belt with repeating Carhartt logos
We built this everyday belt using heavy-duty nylon, so it won't bend if you clip a radio or holster to it
The ladder lock buckle has extra grip, so it doesn't loosen throughout the day
Finished with an engraved logo and printed Carhartt graphics across the webbing
Sizing: Medium (32-34" Waist Size) Large (36-38" Waist Size) X-Large (40-42" Waist Size) Belt Width: 1 1/2"
body.description: We built this everyday belt using heavy-duty nylon, so it won't bend if you clip a radio or holster to it. The design is simple but shows attention to detail. The buckle has extra grip, so it doesn't loosen throughout the day. Woven logos show your Carhartt pride.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great belt, I love the fabric and the color very sturdy and great choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars soso EDC belt, Decent belt just very elastic
reviews.reviewText: Belt is abit on the long side js bare that in mind if you buyDecent belt, good buckle but if youre buying for everyday carry look elsewhere (updated)..Update- been wearing for awhile has worked out good for inwaistband holstering. Comfortable.. i set my belt on the tight side anyways. So far so good.. my former primary belt wasnt a edc focused belt just a dickies latch lock which was very unreliable. Chose this belt over others due to the quick release as ive encounted many situations of having pants on fire welding or ants soo.. good to have feature and buckle seems tough, been good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great belt. Careful with small belt loops
reviews.reviewText: Great belt. Exactly what I was looking for. Durable to last. Tough enough to deal with tools. And the clip seems durable as well. Only downside is the clip barely fits through some belt loops. Some loops that are slightly smaller it can be downright frustrating.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A good rigid belt that keep my pants up
reviews.reviewText: No issues getting it through belt loops. Feels heavy duty like a Riggers belt but much cleaner look for a casual wear.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars The clip belt stretches and has a plastic clip
reviews.reviewText: Ordered the clip belt in thinking it would be faster once I got it sized. Boy was I wrong! First I noticed the actual clip (male side) is completely plastic. Next the buckle (either side) barely fits through the belt loops on my Carhartt double front work pants. When I finally got it around the and was tightening it to size I noticed it stretched! Why?? I now see it says flex in the description but it doesn't mention that in the title. A belt that stretches kinda defeats the purpose not to mention since I have to over tighten it to compensate for the stretching, the buckle is under a lot of stress. Only a matter of time before the little plastic tabs break off. Sending back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Buckle to big to fit through belt loops
reviews.reviewText: This belt had the potential to be fantastic. It seems durable, and I like the adjustability, however, the belt buckle is too large, which drives me absolutely nuts. Even on a pair of Carhartt pants where it should fit easily. It is very tedious to put the buckle through the belt loops. It barely fits through each loop and you have to wrestle it through each one, takes way to long to put on or take off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well fitting belt

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Wasn't what I was wanting
reviews.reviewText: It is a good sturdy belt however it wasn't what I wanted so I returned it. For one it's pretty thick and wide compared to most web belts, it doesn't bend or give easily. Second, the "buckle" clasp is kind of big and combined with the stiffness of the belt, I found the belt cumbersome to slide/fit under avg belt loops. Finally, adjusting the length of the belt on the fly is also more difficult than picking a hole or pulling it through a double loop. Overall it was just too much effort for me, I wanted something more basic and simple. If you are looking for a more robust work belt though this might be a good option.

The belt looks okay and fits well. However, the buckle is simply disappointing. While buckle like this may be well suited to close backpacks etc. a belt that is worn on a daily basis needs something different that is easier to handle, open and adjust.

reviews.reviewTitle: Très confortable et très bonne qualité
reviews.reviewText: Très confortable et très bonne qualité
